archetype_name: Family Low-Fat Mediterranean Light Plates (15–30, Mild)
name: Herbed Turkey, Zucchini & Chickpeas over Quinoa
description: A light, lemony skillet of turkey, zucchini, and chickpeas served over fluffy quinoa with fresh parsley and mint. Mild spices and minimal oil keep it family-friendly and low-fat.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 cup quinoa under cold water in a fine sieve.
Dice 1 red onion and 2 zucchini; halve 1 cup cherry tomatoes.
Rinse and drain 1 can (about 1.5 cups) chickpeas if using canned.
Roughly chop 1/4 cup parsley and 2 tablespoons mint.
Cut 1 lemon into wedges for serving and zest half the lemon.
Preheat oven to 425°F/220°C and set a kettle or pot of water to boil for stock.
cook_steps: Bring 2 cups vegetable stock to a simmer; add rinsed quinoa, cover, and cook on low until fluffy, 15 minutes. Rest 5 minutes, then fluff.
On a sheet pan, toss zucchini and cherry tomatoes with 1 teaspoon olive oil and a pinch of salt and pepper. Roast until tender, 12–15 minutes.
While vegetables roast, heat 1 teaspoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium. Add red onion and cook 3–4 minutes until soft.
Add minced garlic and 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, 1/2 teaspoon oregano, and lemon zest; stir 30 seconds.
Add 1 pound turkey to the skillet. Cook, breaking into small pieces, until just cooked through, 5–6 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Stir in chickpeas and roasted zucchini and tomatoes. Warm 2–3 minutes. Squeeze in juice from 1/2 lemon.
Off heat, fold in parsley and mint. Taste and adjust salt and pepper.
Serve a scoop of quinoa in bowls. Top with the turkey–vegetable mixture. Serve with remaining lemon wedges.
